intro: Gilia lineata, commonly known as the narrowleaf gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and showy, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and thrives in full sun. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Gilia lineata is often found in open landscapes such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
